intro: Erodium macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of South America. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Erodium macrophyllum is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
